intro: Linaria macrocalyx, commonly known as the greater knapweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers have five petals arranged in a distinctive spurred shape. Linaria macrocalyx is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and is also a source of nectar for pollinators.
